description.narrative: Syria Independent Monitoring (SIM) is a large-scale, three year project funded by DFID. The humanitarian spend inside Syria is DFID’s largest ever response to a complex emergency. SIM enables DFID to gain oversight over this response. SIM is being delivered by a consortium of organisations, led by Transtec. Aktis Strategy is responsible for Outputs 1 and 3. Output 1 is the largest work stream of the project and relates to the implementation of monitoring activities inside Syria. Aktis Strategy will also lead on Output 3 – the research component of the SIM project. It is expected that in its second year, SIM will expand to Syria’s neighboring countries and will also deliver additional outputs.
